com.tofik.coolexoplayer.exoplayer.cool

Interface PlayerDispatcher


  • public interface PlayerDispatcher
    This is an addition layer used in PlayerManager. Setting this where getDelayToPlay(CoolPlayer) returns a positive value will result in a delay in playback play(). While returning DELAY_NONE will dispatch the action immediately, and returning DELAY_INFINITE will not dispatch the action.
    Since:
    3.4.0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static PlayerDispatcher DEFAULT 
      static int DELAY_INFINITE 
      static int DELAY_NONE 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getDelayToPlay(CoolPlayer player)
      Return the number of milliseconds that a call to CoolPlayer.play() should be delayed.

    • Field Detail

      • DELAY_INFINITE

        static final int DELAY_INFINITE

        Constant Field Values

      • DELAY_NONE

        static final int DELAY_NONE
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT

        static final PlayerDispatcher DEFAULT

    • Method Detail

      • getDelayToPlay

        int getDelayToPlay(CoolPlayer player)
        Return the number of milliseconds that a call to CoolPlayer.play() should be delayed. Returning DELAY_INFINITE will not start the playback, while returning DELAY_NONE will start it immediately.
        Parameters:
        player - the player that is about to play.
        Returns:
        number of milliseconds to delay the play, or one of DELAY_INFINITE or DELAY_NONE. No other negative number should be used.
